main event: GOC observer reported many red objects observed in Parksburg, Pennsylvania on March 2, 1955.
interesting points: The GOC observer observed red objects that appeared to expand in size,The objects changed color from red to yellowish green upon bursting,The sighting lasted for approximately one hour with continuous flashes every few minutes,The objects were speculated to be about 25 to 35 feet in diameter,There was a follow-up investigation by Allen E. Hynek that concluded the flashes were artillery-like bursts over Aberdeen Proving Grounds.
sighted object: multiple red objects that changed colors upon bursting
